member.name: T:fastJSON.EnumValueFormat
member.summary: Controls the naming format of serialized enum values.

member.name: F:fastJSON.EnumValueFormat.Default
member.summary: The serialized names will be the same as the field name.

member.name: F:fastJSON.EnumValueFormat.LowerCase
member.summary: All letters in the serialized names will be changed to lowercase.

member.name: F:fastJSON.EnumValueFormat.CamelCase
member.summary: The first letter of each serialized names will be changed to lowercase.

member.name: F:fastJSON.EnumValueFormat.UpperCase
member.summary: All letters in the serialized names will be changed to uppercase.

member.name: F:fastJSON.EnumValueFormat.Numeric
member.summary: Enum fields will be serialized numerically.

member.name: T:fastJSON.NamingConvention
member.summary: Controls the letter case of serialized field names.

member.name: F:fastJSON.NamingConvention.Default
member.summary: The letter case of the serialized field names will be the same as the field or member name.

member.name: F:fastJSON.NamingConvention.LowerCase
member.summary: All letters in the serialized field names will be changed to lowercase.

member.name: F:fastJSON.NamingConvention.CamelCase
member.summary: The first letter of each serialized field names will be changed to lowercase.

member.name: F:fastJSON.NamingConvention.UpperCase
member.summary: All letters in the serialized field names will be changed to uppercase.

member.name: T:fastJSON.TriState
member.summary: Indicates the state of a setting.

member.name: F:fastJSON.TriState.Default
member.summary: Represents the normal behavior.

member.name: F:fastJSON.TriState.True
member.summary: Represents a positive setting. Actions should be taken to the object.

member.name: F:fastJSON.TriState.False
member.summary: Represents a negative setting. Actions may not be taken to the object.

member.name: T:fastJSON.IJsonConverter
member.summary: Converts the member value being serialized or deserialized.

remarks.para: During deserialization, the JSON string is parsed and converted to primitive data. The data could be one of the following six types returned from the JSON Parser: , , , , and .
The method should be able to process the above six types, as well as the null value, and convert the value to match the type of the member being deserialized.

If the method returns a instead of null or the type of , the deserializer will firstly attempt to revert the primitive data to match that type, and then pass the reverted value to the method. By this means, the implementation of method does not have to cope with primitive data types.
To implement the method, keep in mind that the in the instance will always be primitive data.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonConverter.GetReversiveType(fastJSON.JsonItem)
member.summary: Returns the expected type from the primitive data in . If the returned type is not null, the deserializer will attempt to convert the of to match the returned type.
member.param: The item to be deserialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonConverter.SerializationConvert(fastJSON.JsonItem)
member.summary: Converts the to a new value during serialization. Either or of the can be changed. However, if the name is changed, the data might not be properly deserialized.
member.param: The item to be deserialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonConverter.DeserializationConvert(fastJSON.JsonItem)

summary.para: Converts the of to a new value during deserialization. The of can be changed to a different type. This enables adapting various data types from deserialization.
The of could be one of six primitive value types. For further information, refer to .

member.param: The item to be deserialized.

member.name: T:fastJSON.JsonConverter`2
member.summary: A helper converter which implements the to convert between two specific types.
member.typeparam: The original type of the data being serialized.
The serialized type of the data.
member.remarks: For further details about implementation, please refer to .

member.summary: Creates an instance of .

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonConverter`2.GetReversiveType(fastJSON.JsonItem)
member.summary: Returns the expected type for . The default implementation returns .
member.param: The item to be deserialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonConverter`2.SerializationConvert(fastJSON.JsonItem)
member.summary: Converts the original value before serialization. If the serialized value is not the type of , the will be returned.
member.param: The item to be deserialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonConverter`2.DeserializationConvert(fastJSON.JsonItem)
member.summary: Reverts the serialized value to . If the serialized value is not the type of , nothing will be changed.
member.param: The item to be deserialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonConverter`2.Convert(System.String,`0)
member.summary: Converts the original value to type before serialization.

The value being serialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonConverter`2.Revert(System.String,`1)
member.summary: Reverts the serialized value to the type.
member.param: The name of the annotated member.
The serialized value.
member.returns: The reverted value which has the same type as the annotated member.

member.name: T:fastJSON.JsonItem
member.summary: Represents a JSON name-value pair.

member.name: P:fastJSON.JsonItem.Renameable
member.summary: Gets whether the property of this instance can be changed.
member.remarks: During serialization, the of the property can be changed, and this value is true. During deserialization or serializing an item of an instance, the can not be changed, and this value is false.

member.name: P:fastJSON.JsonItem.Name
member.summary: The name of the item. During serialization, this property can be changed to serialize the member to another name. If the item is the object initially passed to the method (or its overloads), this value will be an empty string.
member.exception: This value is changed during deserialization or serializing an item of an instance.

member.name: P:fastJSON.JsonItem.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the item. The type and value of this property can be changed. The serializer and deserializer will take the changed value.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonItem.#ctor(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates an instance of .
member.param: The name of the item.
The value of the item.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonDeserializer.CreateObject(fastJSON.JsonDict,fastJSON.ReflectionCache,System.Object)
member.summary: Deserializes an object.
member.param: The data to be deserialized.
The reflection cache of the type.
The data container. If this value is not null, deserialized members will be written to it. If null, new object will be created.

summary.para: An interface to intercept various aspects in JSON serialization and deserialization.
It is recommended to inherit from for easier implementation when possible.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonInterceptor.OnSerializing(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called before values are written out during serialization. If the method returns false, the object will not be serialized.
member.param: The object being serialized.
member.returns: Whether the object should be serialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonInterceptor.SerializeExtraValues(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called before the serialization is finished. Extra values can be returned and written to the serialized result.
member.param: The object being serialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonInterceptor.OnSerialized(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called after the object has been fully serialized.
member.param: The object being serialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonInterceptor.OnSerializing(System.Object,fastJSON.JsonItem)
member.summary: This method is called before serializing a field or a property. If the method returns false, the member will not be serialized.
member.param: The container object.
The item to be serialized.
member.returns: Whether the member should be serialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonInterceptor.OnDeserializing(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called between the object has been created and the values are filled during deserialization. This method provides an opportunity to initialize an object before deserialization.
member.param: The object being deserialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonInterceptor.OnDeserialized(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called after the object has been fully deserialized. Data validation could be done onto the serialized object.
member.param: The object created from deserialization.

member.name: M:fastJSON.IJsonInterceptor.OnDeserializing(System.Object,fastJSON.JsonItem)
member.summary: This method is called before deserializing a field or a property. If the method returns false, the member will not be deserialized.
member.param: The container object.
The item to be deserialized.
member.returns: Whether the member should be deserialized.

member.name: T:fastJSON.JsonInterceptor`1
member.summary: This is a default implementation of , which restricts the type of the object being serialized or deserialized. The default implementation does nothing and returns true for all OnSerializing or OnDeserializing methods.
member.typeparam: The type of the object being serialized or deserialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonInterceptor`1.OnSerializing(`0)
member.summary: This method is called before values are written out during serialization. If the method returns false, the object will not be serialized.
member.param: The object being serialized.
member.returns: Whether the object should be serialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonInterceptor`1.SerializeExtraValues(`0)
member.summary: This method is called before the serialization is finished. Extra values can be returned and written to the serialized result.
member.param: The object being serialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonInterceptor`1.OnSerialized(`0)
member.summary: This method is called after the object has been fully serialized.
member.param: The object being serialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonInterceptor`1.OnDeserializing(`0)
member.summary: This method is called between the object has been created and the values are filled during deserialization. This method provides an opportunity to initialize an object before deserialization.
member.param: The object being deserialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonInterceptor`1.OnDeserialized(`0)
member.summary: This method is called after the object has been fully deserialized. Data validation could be done onto the serialized object.
member.param: The object created from deserialization.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonInterceptor`1.OnSerializing(`0,fastJSON.JsonItem)
member.summary: This method is called before serializing a field or a property. If the method returns false, the member will not be serialized.
member.param: The container object.
The item being serialized.
member.returns: Whether the member should be serialized.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonInterceptor`1.OnDeserializing(`0,fastJSON.JsonItem)
member.summary: This method is called before deserializing a field or a property. If the method returns false, the member will not be deserialized.
member.param: The container object.
The item to be deserialized.
member.returns: Whether the member should be deserialized.

member.name: T:fastJSON.JSONParameters
member.summary: Gives the basic control over JSON serialization and deserialization.

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.UseOptimizedDatasetSchema
member.summary: Uses the optimized fast Dataset Schema format (default = True)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.UseFastGuid
member.summary: Uses the fast GUID format (default = True)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.SerializeNullValues
member.summary: Serializes null values to the output (default = True)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.SerializeStaticMembers
member.summary: Serializes static fields or properties into the output (default = true).

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.SerializeEmptyCollections
member.summary: Serializes arrays, collections, lists or dictionaries with no element (default = true).
member.remarks: If the collection is the root object, it is not affected by this setting. Byte arrays are not affected by this setting either.

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.UseUTCDateTime
member.summary: Use the UTC date format (default = True)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.ShowReadOnlyProperties
member.summary: Shows the read-only properties of types in the output (default = False). has higher precedence than this setting.

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.ShowReadOnlyFields
member.summary: Shows the read-only fields of types in the output (default = False). has higher precedence than this setting.

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.UsingGlobalTypes
member.summary: Uses the $types extension to optimize the output JSON (default = True)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.IgnoreCaseOnDeserialize
member.summary: Ignores case when processing JSON and deserializing

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.EnableAnonymousTypes
member.summary: Anonymous types have read only properties

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.UseExtensions
member.summary: Enables fastJSON extensions $types, $type, $map (default = True). This setting must be set to true if circular reference detection is required.

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.UseEscapedUnicode
member.summary: Use escaped Unicode i.e. \uXXXX format for non ASCII characters (default = True)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.KVStyleStringDictionary
member.summary: Outputs string key dictionaries as "k"/"v" format (default = False)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.UseValuesOfEnums
member.summary: Outputs Enum values instead of names (default = False).

member.name: P:fastJSON.JSONParameters.IgnoreAttributes
member.summary: Ignores attributes to check for (default : XmlIgnoreAttribute)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.ParametricConstructorOverride
member.summary:
If you have parametric and no default constructor for you classes (default = False)
IMPORTANT NOTE : If True then all initial values within the class will be ignored and will be not set. In this case, you can use to assign an to initialize the object.

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.DateTimeMilliseconds
member.summary: Serializes DateTime milliseconds i.e. yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.nnn (default = false)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.SerializerMaxDepth
member.summary: Maximum depth for circular references in inline mode (default = 20)

member.name: F:fastJSON.JSONParameters.InlineCircularReferences
member.summary: Inlines circular or already seen objects instead of replacement with $i (default = False)

member.name: P:fastJSON.JSONParameters.SerializeToLowerCaseNames
member.summary: Saves property/field names as lowercase (default = false)

member.name: P:fastJSON.JSONParameters.NamingConvention
member.summary: Controls the case of serialized field names.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JSONParameters.FixValues
member.summary: Fixes conflicting parameters.

member.name: M:fastJSON.Reflection.CreateWrapperMethod``1(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Creates a wrapper delegate for the given method. The delegate should have a similar signature as the , except that an argument in inserted before the method arguments.
member.typeparam: A delegate definition. The first argument of the delegate will be used to invoke the method.
member.param: The method to be converted to the delegate.
member.returns: The wrapper delegate to invoke the method.

example.code: delegate void MyAddMethod (IEnumerable target, object value); Reflection.CreateWrapperMethod<MyAddMethod> (typeof(List<string>).GetMethod("Add"));

member.name: M:fastJSON.Reflection.FindMethod(System.Type,System.String,System.Type[])
member.summary: Finds a public instance method with the same name as and having arguments match the in the given .
member.param: The type which contains the method.
The method to match.
The types of method arguments. Null value in the array means the corresponding argument can be any type.
member.returns: The method matches the name and argument types.

member.name: P:fastJSON.IMemberInfo.MemberType

member.name: P:fastJSON.IMemberInfo.IsProperty

member.name: P:fastJSON.IMemberInfo.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Indicates whether the member is read-only. Read-only properties or initialized-only fields returns true.

member.name: P:fastJSON.IMemberInfo.IsStatic
member.summary: Indicates whether the member is static.

member.name: P:fastJSON.IMemberInfo.IsPublic

member.name: T:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController
member.summary: The general implementation of , which takes custom attributes such as , , etc. into consideration.

member.name: P:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.UseXmlSerializationAttributes
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether XML serialization attributes should be used to control serialized field names. (default: false)

member.name: P:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.IgnoreAttributes
member.summary: Ignore attributes to check for (default : XmlIgnoreAttribute).

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of . For backward compatibility, is added into .

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an instance of and sets whether option is turned on. For backward compatibility, is added into .
member.param: Controls whether and other serialization attributes should be supported to control serialized field names.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.GetEnumValueFormat(System.Type)
member.summary: This method is called to determine whether the values of the given type should be serialized as its numeric form rather than literal form. The override can be set via the .
member.param: An value type.
member.returns: If the type should be serialized numerically, returns true, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.GetEnumValueName(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: Gets the overridden name for an enum value. The overridden name can be set via the . If null or empty string is returned, the original name of the enum value is used.
member.param: The enum value member.
member.returns: The name of the enum value.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.IsAlwaysDeserializable(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets whether the type is always deserializable. The value can be set via .
member.param: The type to be deserialized.
member.returns: Whether the type can be deserialized even if it is a non-public type.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.GetInterceptor(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the for given type. If no interceptor, null should be returned. The interceptor can be set via .
member.param: The type to be checked.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.GetConverter(System.Type)
member.summary: This method is called to get the for the type. If no converter, null should be returned. The converter can be set via .
member.param: The type to be checked for .

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.GetCollectionContainerName(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the name of the collection container for customized types which implement and have extra members to be serialized.
member.param: The which implements and contains extra members to be serialized.
member.returns: The name of the collection container. If null is returned, no container will be created.
member.remarks: By default, the serializer serializes types which implement interface as JSON arrays. Members of the type will be ignored. And so to the types which implements . To serialize those members, return a non-empty name and the members will be serialized into a field named returned by this method.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.IsMemberSerializable(System.Reflection.MemberInfo,fastJSON.IMemberInfo)
member.summary: Returns whether the specific member is serializable. This value can be set via and . If true is returned, the member will always get serialized. If false is returned, the member will be excluded from serialization. If null is returned, the serialization of the member will be determined by the settings in .
member.param: The member to be serialized.
Reflection information for the member.
member.returns: True is returned if the member is serializable, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.IsMemberDeserializable(System.Reflection.MemberInfo,fastJSON.IMemberInfo)
member.summary: Gets whether a field or a property is deserializable. If false is returned, the member will be excluded from deserialization. By default, writable fields or properties are deserializable. The value can be set via .
member.param: The member to be serialized.
Reflection information for the member.
member.returns: True is returned if the member is serializable, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.GetSerializedNames(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: This method returns possible names for corresponding types of a field or a property. This enables polymorphic serialization and deserialization for abstract classes, interfaces, or object types, with predetermined concrete types. If polymorphic serialization is not used, null or an empty could be returned. The names can be set via .
member.param: The of the field or property.
member.returns: The dictionary contains types and their corresponding names.
member.exception: The type does not derive from the member type.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.GetNonSerializedValues(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: This method returns a series of values that will not be serialized for a field or a property. When the value of the member matches those values, it will not be serialized. If all values can be serialized, null should be returned. The value can be set via .
member.param: The of the field or property.
member.returns: The values which are not serialized for .

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.GetMemberConverter(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: This method returns the to convert values for a field or a property during serialization and deserialization. If no converter is used, null can be returned. The converter can be set via .
member.param: The of the field or property.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonReflectionController.GetMemberItemConverter(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: This method returns an instance to convert item values for a field or a property which is of type during serialization and deserialization. If no converter is used, null can be returned. The converter can be set via .

member.name: T:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController
member.summary: This is an empty implementation of doing nothing but serving as a template class for method-overriding.

member.name: M:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController.GetEnumValueFormat(System.Type)
member.summary: This method is called to determine whether the values of the given type should be serialized as its numeric form rather than literal form.
member.param: An value type.
member.returns: If the type should be serialized numerically, returns true, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController.GetEnumValueName(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: This method is called to override the serialized name of an enum value. If null or empty string is returned, the original name of the enum value is used.
member.param: The enum value member.
member.returns: The name of the enum value.

member.name: M:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController.IsAlwaysDeserializable(System.Type)
member.summary: This method is called before the constructor of a type is built for deserialization to detect whether the type is deserializable. When this method returns true, the type can be deserialized regardless it is a non-public type. Public types are always deserializable and not affected by the value returned from this method. If the type contains generic parameters (for generic types) or an element type (for array types), the parameters and element types will be checked first.
member.param: The type to be deserialized.
member.returns: Whether the type can be deserialized even if it is a non-public type.

member.name: M:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController.GetInterceptor(System.Type)
member.summary: This method is called to get the for the type. If no interceptor, null should be returned.
member.param: The type to be checked.

member.name: M:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController.GetConverter(System.Type)
member.summary: This method is called to get the for the type. If no converter, null should be returned.
member.param: The type to be checked for .

member.name: M:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController.GetCollectionContainerName(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the name of the collection container for customized types which implement and have extra members to be serialized.
member.param: The which implements and contains extra members to be serialized.
member.returns: The name of the collection container. If null is returned, no container will be created.
member.remarks: By default, the serializer serializes types which implement interface as JSON arrays. Members of the type will be ignored. And so to the types which implements . To serialize those members, return a non-empty name and the members will be serialized into a field named returned by this method.

member.name: M:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController.IsMemberSerializable(System.Reflection.MemberInfo,fastJSON.IMemberInfo)
member.summary: This method is called to determine whether a field or a property is serializable. If false is returned, the member will be excluded from serialization. If true is returned, the member will always get serialized. If null is returned, the serialization of the member will be determined by the settings in .
member.param: The member to be serialized.
Reflection information for the member.
member.returns: False is returned if the member is private, otherwise, null is returned.

member.name: M:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController.IsMemberDeserializable(System.Reflection.MemberInfo,fastJSON.IMemberInfo)
member.summary: This method is called to determine whether a field or a property is deserializable. If false is returned, the member will be excluded from deserialization. By default, writable fields or properties are deserializable.
member.param: The member to be serialized.
Reflection information for the member.
member.returns: True is returned if the member is public, otherwise, false.

member.name: M:fastJSON.DefaultReflectionController.GetSerializedNames(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: This method returns possible names for corresponding types of a field or a property. This enables polymorphic serialization and deserialization for abstract, interface, or object types, with predetermined concrete types. If polymorphic serialization is not used, null or an empty could be returned.
member.param: The of the field or property.
member.returns: The dictionary contains types and their corresponding names.

member.summary: This method returns a series of values that will not be serialized for a field or a property. When the value of the member matches those values, it will not be serialized. If all values can be serialized, null should be returned.
member.param: The of the field or property.
member.returns: The values which are not serialized for .

member.summary: This method returns the to convert values for a field or a property during serialization and deserialization. If no converter is used, null can be returned.

member.summary: This method returns an instance to convert item values for a field or a property which is of type during serialization and deserialization. If no converter is used, null can be returned.
member.param: The of the field or property.

member.name: T:fastJSON.IReflectionController
member.summary: The controller interface to control type reflections for serialization and deserialization.

remarks.para: The interface works in the reflection phase. Its methods are executed typically once and the result will be cached. Consequently, changes occur after the reflection phase will not take effect.
It is recommended to inherit from or .

member.summary: This method is called before the constructor of a type is built for deserialization to detect whether the type is deserializable. member.name: M:fastJSON.SafeDictionary`2.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty, has the specified initial capacity, and uses the default equality comparer for the key type.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty, has the default initial capacity, and uses the default equality comparer for the key type.

member.summary: Clears all items.

member.name: M:fastJSON.SafeDictionary`2.TryGetValue(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Gets the value associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key of the value to get.

When this method returns, contains the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: Returns true if the dictionary contains an element with the specified key; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:fastJSON.SafeDictionary`2.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of key/value pairs contained in the dictionary.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the specified key.

member.returns: The value associated with the specified key. If the specified key is not found, a get operation throws a , and a set operation creates a new element with the specified key.

member.summary: Removes specific key from the dictionary.

member.name: T:fastJSON.JsonConverterAttribute
member.summary: Controls data conversion in serialization and deserialization.

remarks.para: This attribute can be applied to types or type members.
If it is applied to types, the converter will be used in all instances of the type, each property or field that has that data type will use the converter prior to serialization or deserialization.
If both the type member and the type has applied this attribute, the attribute on the type member will have a higher precedence.

summary.para: The type of converter to convert string to object. The type should implement .
During serialization and deserialization, an instance of will be used to convert values between their original type and target type.

member.name: M:fastJSON.JsonConverterAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Marks the value of a field or a property to be converted by an .
member.param: The type of the .
member.exception: Exception can be thrown if the type does not implements .

member.name: T:fastJSON.JsonItemConverterAttribute
member.summary: Controls data conversion of items in serialization and deserialization.

summary.para: The type of converter to convert string to object. The type should implement .
During serialization and deserialization, an instance of will be used to convert values between their original type and target type.

member.summary: Marks the item value of a field or a property to be converted by an .
member.param: The type of the .
member.exception: Exception can be thrown if the type does not implements .

member.name: T:fastJSON.SerializationManager
member.summary: A class controls special serialization for specified types and members.

remarks.para: This class can be used to control serialization and deserialization for specified types and members.
The overriding methods, such as , , etc., must be called before serialization or deserialization. Otherwise, inconsistent serialization results may occur between types.

If a class has its subclasses, the override will not be applied to its subclasses.

member.exception: No member is found for a in .
